items.title: National Champion
description: From the 25th - 27th of September I competed in WorldSkills Ireland's Cloud Computing competition sponsored by AWS.
Over three days I completed a series of challenges that tested my knowledge of AWS services and my ability to deploy and manage cloud infrastructure.
At the end, I won the competition and was awarded the title of Cloud Computing Champion and recieved a Silver Medal from the Department of Further and Higher Education.

items.title: VT/STAR Student
description: In May I started my 2-year VT/STAR programme with SAP. This programme involves 2 development rotations, one between my second and third year of college and the other during the third year internship period.

In my first rotation I wrote production code for SAP's state-of-the-art SAP Analytics Cloud product. My work added more functionality to Data Analyzer, a tool that allows users to create and manipulate data models.
The VT/STAR programme in Ireland only accepts 20 students per year, and I am delighted to be one of them.

items.title: Sysadmin
description: In April 2024, I was elected as the Sysadmin of the Computer Science Society (CS++) in TU Dublin. This was following my previous year as Chairperson, and year before that as First Year Rep.

When I was Chair, I restarted the technical aspect of CS++, which went offline back in 2020. I provisioned our first server, and began to restore on-premises hardware, working with the University's IT department to get connected and ensure security & GDPR best-practices.
For the next two years, I will be the Chief System Architect for the society, and lead developer of multiple services.

items.title: President
description: In April 2024, I was elected as President of the TU Dublin Societies Forum. This followed my year of Grangegorman Chairperson.

As President, I chair all Societies Forums, represent Societies to the University, Students' Union, and external Organisations, and work with the University to ensure Societies are supported and have the resources they need.

Since I joined the Societies Forum Executive in 2023, I created the Constitution Template, increased access to spaces in TU Dublin and built strong reputations with the University Faculty and Administration.
